article_title: Spain overhauls bankruptcy laws to make it easier for companies to restructure debt
article_text:
MADRID—Spain is overhauling its rigid bankruptcy laws to make it easier for ailing companies to restructure their debts, addressing a problem that in recent years forced thousands of corporate failures.

A decree approved during a cabinet meeting Friday is among many recommended by the International Monetary Fund to help Spain recover from a deep recession. Starting Monday, banks will get better incentives to accept debt forgiveness,...
